questions.question_text: Which of the following are available publisher packs? (Choose four.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACEF
ACEF
i. Adobe
ii. Citrix
iii. Common
iv. Custom
v. IBM
vi. Microsoft
vii. Oracle
viii. SAP
ix. Subscription
x. VMware

Selected Answer: ACEF
Publisher pack: provides publisher specific licensing metrics for reconciliation and optimization to determine license compliance. When activated, results are displayed in a software publisher compliance dashboard. Publisher packs are available for Adobe, Citrix, IBM, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP, VMWare

Selected Answer: ACEF
https://www.servicenow.com/content/dam/servicenow-assets/public/en-us/doc-type/resource-center/data-sheet/ds-sam-publisher-packs.pdf
The answer given is correct: SAM Professional Fundamentals course, Trustworthy Data, Import Software Data Using System Import Sets, Using System Import Sets

questions.answer_ET: Large amount of data – Discovery; Medium amount of data – Import data; Small amount of data – Manual
questions.answer: Large amount of data – Discovery; Medium amount of data – Import data; Small amount of data – Manual

discussion.content: Actually - E. Software reclamation rule is correct Verified rom page 393 AND 421 in the text included in the ServiceNow SAM Pro course

Selected Answer: E
e. Reclamation: reclamation rules are used to aggregate usage records and identify unused or underutilized software to be flagged for reclamation. They can be configured for:
 Minimum number of hours used 
 Specific time periods
 Notifications to the user and a response

Selected Answer: E
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/sw-reclamation-rules.html

Selected Answer: E
* Ans: E (Stepherbun is correct)
SW Reclamation Rule (Answer E) - it defines the time duration that must be unused (or used) - page 422 in eBook of the SN SAM Pro course
SW usage (Answer A) is only for providing the metering info, not to define (as Must use), so not the correct answer here
A. Software Usage Metering is the right answer

questions.question_text: Which of the following features aggregates usage over a period of time and specifies a minimum number of hours the software must be used, or date last used?

discussion.content:
there is no role called sys_admin.
C (sam_admin) is the right answer

Selected Answer: D
An answer being wrong does not mean an alternative is necessarily right. The answer is 'admin' as others have suggested. 'sam_admin' does not have privileges to review plugin installations directly. 

There are no right answers here but the equivalent to admin, 'sys_admin' is the one the person who submitted these questions had intended to be the correct answer

It's D.
From the Course Lab: As a ServiceNow administrator, I need to validate that all required Software Asset Management functionality... 1. Log in as the System Administrator...

Selected Answer: D
sys_adminというロールはありません。ただし、プラグインのインストール結果を確認するのはシステム管理者の責任であり、それにはadminロールが必要です。私はadminの代わりにsys_adminを選択します。

comments.content: English: There is no role named sys_admin. However, it is the responsibility of the system administrator to check the results of the plugin installation, which requires the admin role. I choose sys_admin instead of admin.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
I would also say sys_admin because of this in the course:
By default, the ServiceNow administrator persona (admin role) is responsible for loading asset management data from integrations and discovery tools into SAM Pro.

This is said specifically out of context to the sam_admin role.

Selected Answer: D
for sure not sys_admin (does not exist). System Administrator [admin] is the correct role. Even though this is in SAM exam, it is one of the general questions. I would still pick this option in the actual test (they have lot of mistakes in them btw)

Selected Answer: C
If there is no "sys_admin", the only right answer is sam_admin...

questions.question_text: By default, which user role must verify the successful activation of plugins by ServiceNow support?

discussion.content:
Definitely BC

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/task/configure-sccm-sam.html

Selected Answer: BC
Microsoft SCCM Integration plugins: integrate Microsoft SCCM with SAM
Microsoft SCCM Software Usage plugins: import software usage data from Microsoft SCCM to SAM. Both SCCM plugins can be installed through System Definitions --> Plugins.

Selected Answer: BC
Explanation in Servicenow Documentation: https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/sccm-software-usage.html

Activate the SCCM integration plugin for your version of SCCM.
Integration — Microsoft SCCM 2012 v2 (com.snc.integration.sccm2012v2)
Integration — Microsoft SCCM 2016 (com.snc.integration.sccm2016)
If you want to pull software usage data from SCCM, activate the software usage plugin for your version of SCCM.

Integration — Microsoft SCCM 2012 v2 Software Usage (com.snc.samp_usage_sccm) plugin
Integration — Microsoft SCCM 2016 Software Usage (com.snc.samp.usage_sccm_2016) plugin

Selected Answer: BC
B & C are the correct option, I read it in the booklet provided by servicenow

comments.content: can you please provide link to booklet?

discussion.content: A & B are the right answer

questions.question_text: When populating software usage records automatically via Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM), which plugins are required? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Performance Analytics Premium for Software Asset Management plugin
